intro: Codonoboea primulina, commonly known as the small primrose bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
